instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP3V3_S0: What is PP3V3_S0? The "PP3V3_S0" rail in a MacBook logic board is a power rail that supplies 3.3 volts to the system when it is fully awake (S0 state). .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD: What is SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD? SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A vcore present not turning on
threads.message:
this previously came in for not charging problem, then i track the problem to smc, and i changed it to same board number smc.
now this came in with intermittent shutdown problem, and suddenly doesnt turn on anymore
I have change vcore fet with fdmf6708n from mouser.
ppbus : 12.56v
vcore : 1.7v
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> : 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S0</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>, pp1v8, all is present
cpu get reasonably warm,not burning my finger..
smc bypass will make the fan spin, but not turning on..
if i plugged magsafe normally, no fan spin, no caps lock light, no chime, no lcd activation, no usb activity ( mouse doesnt light up ).. but trackpad still can click..

i notice that i don't have <SIGNAL>SYS_PWROK_R</SIGNAL> from <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, is that a problem ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A vcore present not turning on
threads.message:
PCH requires that signal, to know all voltages are present.
What about pins 5/6?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A vcore present not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A vcore present not turning on
threads.message:
so I don't have <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>.. and i previously worked on smc too, i changed smc, and now its turning on..
do each pad of smc can die on its own ? what type of smc fail you encounter the most ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A vcore present not turning on
threads.message:
The moisture is the first enemy of SMC.
Accummulated crap corrodes the balls and generates lost connections.
